snippet.textDisplay: Rehman sir u r like an addiction... snippet.textDisplay:
Part-2, Why did I open my eyes?I do not knowIn God’s creations
Anything is beautiful and,Your eyes won’t know that!
Why am I born?,Why did I open my eyes?
I do not know...,All those fetuses are not sinned
Who are you and I,to find a fault in?
A hole in the bamboo stick,Brings out a good song
Even the clouds turn dark and black,But they bring the rain back
For survival of crops!For survival of mankind!!
Why am I born?.

snippet.textDisplay:
All those fetuses are not sinned,Who are you and Ito find a fault in?
A hole in the bamboo stick,Brings out a good song
to bring the rain back,for survival of crops and
for survival of mankind!
A hut in a village,Green trees lined up by the river
And there lived people,that are Open and innocent...
In the sound of the banyan tree,Everyone in deep sleep.Earth is so far away
And who would know the reason?
Why are you born?  Why are you born? Why are you born?
Why am I born?
snippet.textOriginal:
All those fetuses are not sinned,Who are you and Ito find a fault in?
A hole in the bamboo stick,Brings out a good song
to bring the rain back,for survival of crops and
for survival of mankind!
A hut in a village,Green trees lined up by the river
And there lived people,that are Open and innocent...
In the sound of the banyan tree,Everyone in deep sleep.Earth is so far away
And who would know the reason?
Why are you born?  Why are you born? Why are you born?
Why am I born?

snippet.textDisplay:
Agree MSV is much,much better than Raja. But ARR is way better than Raja.

Raja's most compositions were Village based songs which was copied/inspired by native village songs...  So during Raja time when people hard his songs they felt the tune was so familiar but with the music. So they were no creativity. 
ARR was a trend setter. He showed a completely different music from MSV & Raja (Raja songs were very similar to MSV). He broke all the barriers and went high and high.

snippet.textDisplay:
When you take this song in a woman's perspective(ARR composed this song in his sister's perspective ), it gives them a hope.

This song is suitable for women empowerment. 
Whenever I listen this song, two things will be flashing in my mind: 
1) This song should be dedicated to the victims of rape incidents happening in India.
2) The purpose of my existence: Rahman composes, therefore I am (I exist)

snippet.textDisplay:
As the content says, this song is about existentialism. 
Now, Even though it says that "where man wonders...", you wouldn't find a single word in this song which is gender specific.

About the content, It's all about just one question, but thoughtful.
What is the purpose of my existence?

Now the best part of this song is it doesn't give any specific reason for the frustration, but it gives you a hope.
snippet.textOriginal:
As the content says, this song is about existentialism. 
Now, Even though it says that "where man wonders...", you wouldn't find a single word in this song which is gender specific.

About the content, It's all about just one question, but thoughtful.
What is the purpose of my existence?

Now the best part of this song is it doesn't give any specific reason for the frustration, but it gives you a hope.

snippet.textDisplay:
Now the best part ,
 Naan aen piranthaen - why am I born? Kan aen thiranthaen-> Why did I open my eyes? enakae theriyathae-> Even I dont know the reasons
[Someone replies to her question]
In GOD's creation everything is beautiful, your eyes may not see it..

The END
I tried to cover the important lines, hope I covered most of them.
The lyric were written by a tamil poet Valee who died recently, I think ARR is giving a tribute.
You owe me a translation :) enjoy the music


 }

snippet.textDisplay:
AR
[a lullaby sung by some one to the girl]
A  hut in a beautiful village with trees lining up the river sides,
Pure and innocent people of village are sleeping..aariro aariro [aariro just a gibberish word in a lullaby but the intention is  asking baby to sleep]
Who will tell the reason of your birth in this lonely world ...
contd...
snippet.textOriginal:
AR
[a lullaby sung by some one to the girl]
A  hut in a beautiful village with trees lining up the river sides,

snippet.textDisplay:
The song is about a girl shunned by society because of her dark skin and abject poverty. About her agony on being lonely and persecuted and how she redeems herself from these obstacles and oppression.
Rayhanah:
No life  here is lowly ,who are we to find fault in others
Even a flute with holes produces nice music [ something with holes/defect doesn't mean its useless, analogy to flute]
A black cloud gives us rain, with which lives thrive
contd..
snippet.textOriginal:
The song is about a girl shunned by society because of her dark skin and abject poverty. About her agony on being lonely and persecuted and how she redeems herself from these obstacles and oppression.
Rayhanah:

Even a flute with holes produces nice music [ something with holes/defect doesn't mean its useless, analogy to flute]
A black cloud gives us rain, with which lives thrive
contd..

snippet.textDisplay: Meaning of the Song/ rather the feel of the song I should say: A song of an Orphan who grew up with in a Hut next to a tree and River confused about why he was born and real world far far away from him. "Naan Yen Piranthen?? --- Why was ever born??", "Ennake Theriyathe ----Dont know why was ever Born".  A Song of an Orphan trying to find the purpose of why the child was born in a Confused, a bit Sad song.
snippet.textOriginal: Meaning of the Song/ rather the feel of the song I should say: A song of an Orphan who grew up with in a Hut next to a tree and River confused about why he was born and real world far far away from him. "Naan Yen Piranthen?? --- Why was ever born??", "Ennake Theriyathe ----Dont know why was ever Born".  A Song of an Orphan trying to find the purpose of why the child was born in a Confused, a bit Sad song.

snippet.textDisplay: see understand that everyone may not be as enlightened as you are spiritually..and everyone has different ways of reaching that understanding..because they feel one way suits them than the other..or exposure and experience of something that you can relate more towards lead you to choose a particular way of doing things over the other..and this way keeps evolving and get better from time to time for any human..and also is the idea of god..
